entry.title: A room, a bar and a classroom: how the coronavirus is spread through the air
entry.quote: The risk of contagion is highest in indoor spaces but can be reduced by applying all available measures to combat infection via aerosols. Here is an overview of the likelihood of infection in three everyday scenarios, based on the safety measures used and the length of exposure

entry.title: The (Not Failing) New York Times
entry.quote: A decade ago, the NYT was a dying buisness like every other newspaper, ten years, later they've completely turned things around. They accomplished this by cleaning up their balance sheet so they could invest in their core product; which enabled them to flip their business model from ad-first to subscription-first

entry.title: A clean start for the web
entry.quote: e idea is that we could choose a new lightweight markdown format to replace HTML & CSS, split the web into documents and applications, and find performance, accessibility, and fun again.

entry.title: Designing with Data | Giorgia Lupi
entry.quote: Learn about Giorgia’s stunning data visualizations and why you should create your own personal data diary.

entry.title: Dennis Ritchie Day
entry.quote: When Steve Jobs died there was a wide lament — and well-deserved it was — but it’s worth noting that the resurgence of Apple depended a great deal on Dennis’ work with C and Unix.
